alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:53AM EST until January 29 at 10:37PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Cass River At Frankenmuth affecting Saginaw County. For the Cass River...including Frankenmuth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cass River at Frankenmuth. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, the river begins to overflow its banks in places, flooding adjacent low lands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EST.
